column4: When running dhclient I get "No DHCPOFFERS Received. No working leases in persistent database -- sleep"... any idea what I could do?
try sudo mii-diag eth0 (or whatever your interface is) and see whether it says "You have link beat"
it brings up a load of other info, but it doesn't say that, nope.
does it say "   Link status: not established."
then check your physical connection to the network, something goes wrong there
I don't think that's it (just triple-checked it), since this came as a result of someone playing around with the network details
I originally did a dhclient which fixed it just fine, but the computer restarted later and when it came up dhclient wasn't working
as in, there was no messing with the physical connection, at all, and it was working before, so I'd presume the problem wasn't there...
well, if mii-diag say "Link status: not establshed" there is a problem with the physical connection...
I find that hard to believe since it's always worked fine, but I may try switching the cable later. Thanks for your help. :)
ah, just read topic...not recommended. Any date for when users should try it out?
not yet, there are 3 major transitions going on. After these have finished, it's time to try out
excellent, great stuff. No rest for Ubuntu devs ;-).
amarok leads to kde, kde leads to fear, fear leads to anger, anger leads to hate, hate leads to suffering
kde leads to fear? I've always imagined kde-land as a happy place filled with joy
while I kind of imagine myself as too powerful/big for gnomes
